page.title: 05Transport. Town Arch Closure
page.content: The town arch was built in the 1200's. In 1985 a crack in the pedestrian arch in the springing stone was spotted by a member of Monmouth district council. This crack was probably caused by large vehicles colliding with the arch but it can be repaired.To make it safe again{it will cost about Â£80,000}to repair the lower part, and{for the top {about Â£18,000.}The money to pay for this will come from two nurses.At least half will come from government grants.The rest,hopefully,will come from chepstow rate payers and from appeals.The lower part will be finished in about 3\ months time. The whole thing should be finished in about 5-6 months.The idea is to pump glue into the wall which will hold together,because the inside is damaged,the outside stone may crack and fall,and the arch disintergrate.
